command.name: record-route

parameter.name: input
parameter.description: input file (list of destinations to probe)

command.abstract: record the routes from all the topology

description.p: This command records the paths towards the given prefix from each router specified in the in-file and writes those paths in the out-file. The in-file has the following format: each line contains the identifier of a domain (i.e. its AS-NUM) from which the path has to be computed or an asterisk (*) which means that the paths from all the routers have to be computed.

Example:
For instance, here is the result of the EBGP_2_ROUTERS example. The path from AS1 is "1" because it has advertised the prefix 0.1/16. The path from AS2 is "2 1" because it has received a BGP message with the prefix 0.1/16 from AS1.
1 0.1.0.0/16 1
2 0.1.0.0/16 2 1
